title: Web3
blurb: A user-empowering internet that encodes trust and value natively using cryptography, blockchains, and open protocols.

children.title: Foundations & Principles
children.blurb: The philosophies and properties that make Web3 distinct from Web2.

children.title: Decentralization
children.blurb: Shift of control from single authorities to distributed participants.

children.title: Trust & Security
children.blurb: Trust arises from math and incentives rather than intermediaries.

children.title: Identity & Privacy
children.blurb: Self-sovereign identity (SSI) and selective disclosure with modern cryptography.

children.title: Governance & DAOs
children.blurb: On-chain rules and token-holder voting coordinate groups transparently.

children.title: Interoperability
children.blurb: Composability and cross-chain bridges enable ecosystems to connect.

children.title: Blockchain Infrastructure
children.blurb: Systems that run the ledger, scale throughput, and store data.

children.title: Layer-1 Blockchains
children.blurb: Base networks like Ethereum, Solana, Cosmos zones, etc.

children.title: Layer-2 Scalability
children.blurb: Rollups and channels that increase capacity while inheriting L1 security.

children.title: Consensus Mechanisms
children.blurb: Protocols (PoS, PoW, etc.) to agree securely on the ledger state.

children.title: Storage & Data
children.blurb: Decentralized storage such as IPFS/Filecoin; indexers and data availability.

children.title: Networking & Nodes
children.blurb: Peer-to-peer networking, clients, validators, and node operations.

children.title: Smart Contracts & Protocols
children.blurb: Programmable agreements and the standards that make them interoperable.

children.title: Languages & VMs
children.blurb: Solidity, Vyper, Move; EVM and WASM execution.

children.title: Oracles & Off-chain
children.blurb: Bring external data/computation on-chain securely.

children.title: Standards & Interfaces
children.blurb: Token and protocol interfaces (e.g., ERCs) that enable composability.

children.title: Verification & Testing
children.blurb: Audits, fuzzing, formal proofs to reduce vulnerabilities.

children.title: Upgradeability & Patterns
children.blurb: Proxy patterns, governance-gated changes, safe migration.

children.title: Digital Assets & Tokenomics
children.blurb: Design of tokens, incentives, and value capture.

children.title: Fungible Tokens
children.blurb: Interchangeable assets used for utility, governance, or payments.

children.title: Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs)
children.blurb: Unique assets representing art, tickets, identity, or RWAs.

children.title: Stablecoins
children.blurb: Price-stable tokens (fiat-backed, crypto-collateralized, or algorithmic).

children.title: Treasury & DAOs
children.blurb: On-chain treasuries, voting power, and capital allocation.

children.title: Incentives & Game Theory
children.blurb: Token emissions, staking, and mechanism design to align behavior.

children.title: Applications & Ecosystems
children.blurb: User-facing use cases and the surrounding landscape.

children.title: DeFi
children.blurb: Open financial primitives: exchange, lending, derivatives, asset management.

children.title: Web3 Social
children.blurb: User-owned graphs, portable handles, creator monetization.

children.title: Gaming & Metaverse
children.blurb: Playable economies, digital ownership, interoperable assets.

children.title: Supply Chain & RWAs
children.blurb: Track provenance and tokenize real-world assets.

children.title: Regulation & Compliance
children.blurb: KYC/AML approaches, travel-rule tools, and policy trends.
